intro: Kuepferia leucantha, commonly known as the white kuepferia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Kuepferia leucantha is valued in gardens for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
